column4: im trying to set the permission on a .sh file, but the changes dont take effect weather i do them from consolr of the file manager. help?
what kind of changes, and is the file system the file is one writeable and allowing these kind of changes?
e.g. some file systems are noexec, so +x wouldn't work
its a file in my user dir i just downloaded with git. I want to all myself to execute the file.
ive been trying with chmod 764
do you get any error messages?
no
and ls -l on the file gives you what?
-rw------- 1 ezra ezra
sure you are applying the changes on the right file?
when i try to execue the sh file in console it says permission denied
can I see the whole command you try to execute to change the permissions?
http://pastebin.com/tdgHusra
first of all, only sudo when needed. Then: ./build_all.sh  << this with the ./ won't work
chmod u+rwx filename    would be correct
as long as you are the owner, which, from the output above, I assume you are
yeah.. well it dosnt work. I cant change the permissions and i cant run the sh file :(
do you get any errors when doing  just a  chmod u+rwx build_all.sh?
no
and ls -l says what currently?
same as before
if still not the right permissions: sure it's not on a filesystem which is mounted noexec?
hmm well that im not sure, but it wasnt actusally in my user dir. it was on a seperate disk, moving it to the home dir let me chnage it
